org.jdbi.v3.core

Class Query<ResultType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jdbi.v3.core.SqlStatement<Query<ResultType>>
      • org.jdbi.v3.core.Query<ResultType>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Iterable<ResultType>, Configurable<Query<ResultType>>, ResultBearing<ResultType>

    public class Query<ResultType>
extends SqlStatement<Query<ResultType>>
implements ResultBearing<ResultType>
    Statement providing convenience result handling for SQL queries. The default mapping to Map<String, Object> unfortunately does not mesh well with SQL's case-insensitivity, so all identifiers are converted to lower-case using Locale.ROOT. If you require different behavior, implement a custom mapper. The default mapper also carries a performance penalty because it must inspect metadata for each row.

        public <R> R execute(StatementExecutor<ResultType,R> executor)

      • mapToBean

        public <T> Query<T> mapToBean(Class<T> resultType)
        Provide basic JavaBean mapping capabilities. Will instantiate an instance of resultType for each row and set the JavaBean properties which match fields in the result set.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the JavaBean class to map result rows to.
        Parameters:
        resultType - JavaBean class to map result set fields into the properties of, by name
        Returns:
        a Query which provides the bean property mapping

      • setFetchSize

        public Query<ResultType> setFetchSize(int fetchSize)
        Specify the fetch size for the query. This should cause the results to be fetched from the underlying RDBMS in groups of rows equal to the number passed. This is useful for doing chunked streaming of results when exhausting memory could be a problem.
        Parameters:
        fetchSize - the number of rows to fetch in a bunch
        Returns:
        the modified query

      • setMaxRows

        public Query<ResultType> setMaxRows(int maxRows)
        Specify the maximum number of rows the query is to return. This uses the underlying JDBC Statement.setMaxRows(int)}.
        Parameters:
        maxRows - maximum number of rows to return
        Returns:
        modified query

        public Query<ResultType> concurrentUpdatable()
